title: H2 storage - percent yield when 70.g Li3N reacts

content.description:
Li3N(s) + 2 H2(g) ⇄ LiNH2(s) + 2 LiH(s) 
ΔH° = -192 kJ/molrxn 
Because pure H2 is a hazardous substance, safer and more cost effective techniques to store it as a solid for shipping purposes have been developed. One such method is the reaction represented above, which occurs at 200°C.
content.question: When 70. g of Li3N(s) (molar mass 35 g/mol) reacts with excess H2(g), 8.0 g of LiH(s) is produced. The percent yield is closest to

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
